fields.description:
Currently, there will be a warning when closing/complete a review if there is a reviewer haven't finish reviewing (100% complete) on the review.

It will be better if there is an option in Administration to disable the Review Close/Complete button if there is a reviewer haven't finish reviewing on the review. https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Progress+Tracking
fields.summary: Disable Review Close/Complete button if there is one reviewer haven't finish reviewing

fields.description: In the page of review coverage, all chinese strings are replaces by "??" and the page encoding is utf8. All the other pages can show correctly  and I hava no idea about it.
fields.summary: Review Coverage Page's  Chinese Strings repalced by "??"

fields.description:
Crucible throws a "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Cannot have null or empty arguments, arg 0 was null" error when editing the FishEye Project Content without any active repositories.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a project with a default repository.
# Stop all the existing repositories.
# Edit the FishEye Content of the created project.
# The drop down list is now empty. Select "Use whole repository" and click "Add".
# [An "IllegalArgumentException" error is thrown|^screenshot1.png]
fields.summary: IllegalArgumentException When Editing the FishEye Project Content Without Active Repositories

fields.description:
Frequently, things like assets are added to a crucible review from a changeset, but do not be part of the actual review.  In a lot of cases, these files are kept in the same directory, and if we could remove the entire directory from the review, that would make life easier.

Alternately, being able to exclude files, potentially by type or extension, would be nice.
fields.summary: Provide an interface for removing trees from a review

fields.description:
The way FishEye handles the data gathered via remote call should be improved. Currently the data are processed via SOAP request, resulting in certain characters are not being parsed in FishEye which leads to error.

When a JIRA issue being linked in the Crucible review, the error below is thrown in the Crucible logs. The error below is thrown because of the availabilty of certain character in the JIRA issue's description. 

{noformat}
2014-03-07 18:18:11,736 DEBUG [qtp1788226354-170 ] fisheye JiraIssueUtil-buildJiraException - JIRA Server Your Company JIRA: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; Premature end of file.
com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.RemoteJiraException: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; Premature end of file.
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.soap.JiraUALSoapInvoker.invokeOperation(JiraUALSoapInvoker.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.soap.AbstractJiraSoapInvoker.invoke(AbstractJiraSoapInvoker.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.JiraServerImpl.invoke(JiraServerImpl.java:270)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.JiraServerImpl.getIssue(JiraServerImpl.java:275)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.issue.JiraIssueServiceImpl.retrieveJiraIssue(JiraIssueServiceImpl.java:168)
...
{noformat}

To reproduce the error, perform the following:-
# Create a JIRA issue with the special characters below in the description
{noformat}
GIF89a€ÿÿÿ!ù,@L;
{noformat}
# Try link the issue in Crucible review.

It had been already mentioned that the issue will not be fixed in JIRA : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30495
fields.summary: Change FishEye's remote call from SOAP to REST for Crucible link issue

fields.description:
The current approach for adding a comment for diffs in a crucible is to click on the
screen. Some users have reported that this style leads to comments being
accidentally created when the user is just trying to set focus to the
screen, or click on the screen for some other purpose.

Is it possible to have options for creating comments, possibly having a double
click be the mouse input, or perhaps restricting comment creation to clicks
on a specific part of the screen etc
fields.summary: Button Options For Crucible Diff Comments

fields.description:
HTR:
- Give a user permission to create a review.
- Restrict permission to edit a review from that user.
- Create a new review.
- The "Add Content" window appears.
- Click on any item on the screen.
- Spinner spins forever.

Suggestions:
- Display a permission error.
- Prevent the "Add Content" screen from appearing.
fields.summary: "Add Content" spins indefinitely when user lacks permission to "Edit Review Details"

fields.description: Fisheye "Edit review" functionality doesn't work (PFA screenshot), so I'm not able to set proper moderator, add reviewers, etc., basically Code review process is blocked.
fields.summary: Fisheye Edit review feature doesn't work

fields.description: Is there a smart commit option to send a crucible review to an email group id? We sometimes send the code changes to subject matter experts across the organization, and it would be ideal to send a few code reviews their way by way of an email id.
fields.summary: Smart Commit option for sending reviews to email addresses

fields.description:
It could be great that either:
1. Allow JIRA transition screens be shown at Crucible, or
2. Allow admins to disable JIRA Transition button, in order to users not become tempted to transition the linked JIRA issue
fields.summary: Disable transition button in FishEye

fields.description:
If migrating or restoring to a MySQL 5.5 database our scripts will fail due to a change in the way that MySQL references the engine type. Starting with version 5.5, MySQL changed the syntax referencing the engine type from TYPE=INNODB to ENGINE=INNODB which conflicts with our current migration scripts.

*Stack trace*
{noformat}
14:43:41 ERROR - Database migration failed: com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.CruDBException: Problem with create tables script /Users/grefosco/Documents/Atlassian/FishEye/fecru-2.2.0/sql/MYSQL/schema/tables_63.sql
com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.CruDBException: Problem with create tables script /Users/grefosco/Documents/Atlassian/FishEye/fecru-2.2.0/sql/MYSQL/schema/tables_63.sql
    at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.createTables(DefaultDBControl.java:241)
    at com.atlassian.crucible.migration.item.DBImporter.importData(DBImporter.java:111)
    at com.cenqua.crucible.actions.admin.database.DBEditHelper$ImportRunner.call(DBEditHelper.java:78)
    at com.cenqua.crucible.actions.admin.database.DBEditHelper$ImportRunner.call(DBEditHelper.java:60)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
    at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:98)
    at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:206)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:695)
Caused by: com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.CruDBException: SQL script error on line 1: "create table cru_base_star_model (cru_star_id integer not null, cru_item_type varchar(80) not null, cru_string_key1 varchar(255), cru_string_key2 varchar(255), cru_string_key3 varchar(255), cru_string_key4 varchar(255), cru_string_key5 varchar(255), cru_int_key1 integer, cru_int_key2 integer, cru_int_key3 integer, cru_int_key4 integer, cru_int_key5 integer, cru_text_key1 mediumtext, cru_text_key2 mediumtext, cru_user_name varchar(255), cru_date_created bigint, cru_label varchar(255), primary key (cru_star_id)) type=InnoDB;" 
(You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'type=InnoDB' at line 1), please contact http://www.atlassian.com/support/
    at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:395)
    at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:347)
    at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.createTables(DefaultDBControl.java:235)
    ... 10 more
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'type=InnoDB' at line 1
    at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:39)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:27)
    at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:513)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.Util.handleNewInstance(Util.java:406)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.Util.getInstance(Util.java:381)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1030)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:956)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3558)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3490)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:1959)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2109)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2642)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1647)
    at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeUpdate(StatementImpl.java:1566)
    at com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DefaultDBControl.executeScript(DefaultDBControl.java:377)
    ... 12 more
{noformat}

*Workaround*
The workaround is to change manually all the "TYPE=INNODB" contained in the scripts to "ENGINE=INNODB".

For instance, in the logs above, it shows /Users/grefosco/Documents/Atlassian/FishEye/fecru-2.2.0/sql/MYSQL/schema/tables_63.sql, which means the script tables_63.sql must be changed manually.
fields.summary: Migration/restore fails while using MySQL > 5.5

fields.description:
With both products licensed (more FishEye license seats than Crucible license seats) adding users manually to FishEye/Crucible automatically adds each user to a Crucible license seat. After the Crucible license seats have been exhausted an error message is presented upon user add.


h4. Workaround
# Edit existing users and remove Crucible access.
# Continue adding users.
fields.summary: Add option to license user for Crucible access upon user creation

fields.description: All versions affected
fields.summary: Project page gets date of most recent changes very inefficiently
Going to next comment into a file review is very slow on 7000+ lines source code

"Fixed issue #42 +review STD-1" - don't work
"Fixed issue 42 +review STD-1"    - works

It should parse only after "+review".

fields.description:
There is a minor bug that was found in the Apache Axis WebService version 1.4 that affects the XML Remote Procedure Call as documented here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AXIS-2850. The bug had been fixed in the 1.4.1 version of the Apache Axis WebService.

The bug cause an intermittent error in the XML RPC between the FishEye and Jira as shown below. When a Crucible review is closed, the issue you are trying to view does not exist error is thrown and followed by the following error below-.

{noformat}
Caused by: javax.xml.rpc.JAXRPCException: Number of parameters passed in (2) doesn't match the number of IN/INOUT parameters (1) from the addParameter() calls
	at org.apache.axis.AxisFault.makeFault(AxisFault.java:101)
	at org.apache.axis.client.Call.invoke(Call.java:1828)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.soap.axis.JirasoapserviceV2SoapBindingStub.hasPermissionToCreateWorklog(JirasoapserviceV2SoapBindingStub.java:7089)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.JiraIssueImpl$2.run(JiraIssueImpl.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.JiraIssueImpl$2.run(JiraIssueImpl.java:250)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.jira.soap.JiraUALSoapInvoker.invokeOperation(JiraUALSoapInvoker.java:41)
	... 200 more
{noformat}
fields.summary: An error occurred determining if JIRA time tracking is available

fields.description:
There are two problems:

StringUtil.isText() does not check for UTF-8
The setUploadContentType() methods AddUploadBaseAction -and CreateSnippetAction- do not use our suffix to mime-type mapping file -- they just use whatever content type is suggested by Webwork's FileUploadInterceptor.

*edit* CreateSnippetAction is OK -- it doesn't actually use uploads.
fields.summary: Review Attachments do not have their encoding correctly determined

fields.description:
Even on HDTV monitor 1/3 height of the view of some file review is taken by title and description of the issue.

This came with 3.3 version.

It will be much more convenient if title + description + reviewers icons takes much less space and more space is dedicated for the code itself.
fields.summary: Too much screen space is wasted for nothing

fields.description:
Add a file to a review via REST, e.g. using the attached form.

If you add a pair of files (i.e. provide a 'diff to' file) the two revisions appear correctly. If you then add a single revision of a file with the same name, it appears as another revision of the same file, and a diff between it and the second revision of the previous upload is shown.

But the status shown when comparing revisions 2 and 3 is 'Added', and because of this the 'View' dropdown menu is not shown.

Also, no email is sent to existing reviewers.
fields.summary: Files added to a review via REST are treated as 'added', even if they are identified as revisions of a file already in the review. Mail is not sent to revewiwers.

fields.description:
h3. Original request

{quote}The inline issue creation is a very nice feature. However, we can't use it, because the field type 'Select List' is not supported. 

I'm aware that we can create the issue directly in Jira, but this won't create a link from the comment to the issue. The link will be very badly missed by our developers!

Please add support for the 'Select List' field type.{quote}

h3. Revised suggestion

Currently when creating a Jira issue from a review comment, the following fields are presented (in addition to Jira Instance, Jira Project and Jira Issue Type): 
 * summary 
 * description

Consequence: 
 * it is not possible to create an issue if other fields are marked as mandatory in the scheme
 * it is not possible to provide more data (than just summary and description) when creating an issue

Required improvement:
 * show all mandatory fields on the issue creation screen
 * support not only text, but also a date, select list, affects/fix version

Out of scope:
 * support for custom field types (i.e. coming from plugins)
fields.summary: Support mandatory fields and non-text field types for inline issue creation

fields.description: When Adding Content to a review from a git repository that is using a {{.mailmap}} file the Author field pre-populates with the last true committing author as opposed to respecting the {{.mailmap}} file. Once the Author field drop-down is triggered only then are the mapped authors correctly displayed.
fields.summary: Bad author on review Add Content when using a .mailmap file

fields.description:
When you open:
https://site/cru/review-id

in your domain. If it contains multiple patches - they will not be sorted in any logical order in the Left panel. It will be much more understandable and usable if they are sorted in addition order.
fields.summary: Patches are not sorted in Left Panel of Review page

fields.description: The REST API doesn't allow to create a review if the patch can't be anchored so we can't use the python CLI script for creating reviews. The html interface allows this.
fields.summary: REST API doesn't allow to create a review if the patch can't be anchored

fields.description: Owner field is not sorted correctly. If you press to sort it and there is a Moderator. All rows are sorted only by the moderator first. It needs to be sorted first by the moderator and second by author. Currently we cannot sort by author from this view.
fields.summary: "Owner" field sorting is incorrect
P4 diff on recent versions of Perforce does not produce the unified diff header we expect, even with the correct flags

fields.description:
Hi, 
I represents IT Department in Sberbank CIB (Moscow). 
To complete integration of Crucible with our Code Review processes we need to resolve a little problem.

When I'm creating a new patch which includes some scripts, which doesn't exists in repository (unversioned file) and contains some cyrillic symbols, this changes appears in Code Review task incorrectly (example pic1).

If changes have been commited into repository the cyrillic symbols shows correctly.
When I'm loading patch into Crucible I'm choosing windows-1251 codifier.

We're using Crucible 3.1.3 20130917011630
fields.summary: Cyrillic symbols doesn't work in patches, includes scripts, which haven't been commited into repository

fields.description:
Sometimes crucible takes a little while to pick up my commits. Its annoying to have to close and reopen it to see if its got those commits yet. 

There is a button "Show newer commits" (or something).  But a) I wasn't sure what it would do and still not sure if it did what I wanted. b) it disappears after the first time you click it
fields.summary: Ability to refresh commit list in the add content dialog

fields.description:
Ever since the new layout, i have been forced to use full screen mode (there is just not enough space in the new view for the actual code).

However when I get to the end of the review, I have to get back out of full screen mode to find the complete button.  I could not even find a keyboard shortcut for completing the review.

Its an unnecessary and annoying step.
fields.summary: Can complete review in full screen mode

fields.description: For some users it was going to be really useful if Crucible could trigger an action when a review is closed, like a sh, bat or other script.
fields.summary: Trigger a script once the review gets closed

fields.description: In our organization we want to start with cross-project reviews. For this reason, we don't want only to add some "Whole Files" to a review, instead we want to add whole module-directories with hundreds of Source-Files. This is very time-consuming today, because we need to add each file in a directory.
fields.summary: As a Review-Author I want to add whole module-directories to review

fields.description: The keyboard shortcuts dialog cannot be scrolled using the keyboard, so for users who can't use a mouse it's not possible to view all the keyboard shortcuts available to them.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts dialog is not keyboard accessible

fields.description:
If you add a revision of a binary file, then create a review containing it before the 'infill' stage is complete (i.e. when it still has a ? icon next to it when viewed in the activity stream) a non-binary CrucibleRevision will be created for it (table {{cru_revision}}) and it will render as text in that review and in any future review created for the same revision.

Until infill finishes, FishEye rendering is broken too, but then it self-heals. However, the Crucible data, which has already cached the binary flag, is never fixed.
h5. Workaround #1 - update the DB manually

As always, _prior_ to operating on the database:
# *Create a backup*. 
# Shut down the FishEye/Crucible instance.

Next, execute the following script to fix the existing crucible reviews (substitute {{<FILE_PATTERN>}} with a pattern that matches the files experiencing the problem).
{code:java}
UPDATE cru_revision 
SET cru_binary = true
WHERE cru_path IN (
        SELECT cru_revision.cru_path
        FROM cru_revision
        JOIN cru_stored_path
        ON cru_revision.cru_path = cru_stored_path.cru_path_id
        WHERE cru_stored_path.cru_path LIKE '<FILE PATTERN>'
)
AND cru_binary = false

{code}

h5. Workaround #2 - postpone review creation
Another way to avoid this issue is to postpone review creation until the file has been fully scanned. Users can check that by viewing the respective file revision in FishEye and ensuring it is not displayed as garbage text.
fields.summary: Creating a review of a binary revision before SVN processing is complete renders binary file as text

fields.description:
The Admin ui allows users to be disabled en masse from Crucible.
We need a way to do the reverse too - enable users to Crucible en masse.

see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Upgrading+from+FishEye+to+Crucible?focusedCommentId=448037284&#comment-448037284

If an instance is configured to be 'FishEye only', then all users created will have Crucible disabled.

When an instance then upgrades to a Crucible license, all users remain to have Crucible disabled.

There is currently a 'Disable selected users from Crucible' link on the edit users admin screen. This needs to be extended to allow admins to also enable Crucible users in bulk.
fields.summary: Allow bulk activation of Crucible users

fields.description:
We allow only the author of a comment to modify it.

While this is mostly a good idea it means that you can't create an automated task which enhances existing comments via the REST interface.

You can write a plugin which does this by using the ImpersonationService, but that is more difficult.
fields.summary: Allow administrator to edit comments

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Apply both a FishEye and a Crucible license
# Navigate to an existing review and check for *Prefs > Author* for example, disable the column
# Go to *Administration > System Info* and remove the FishEye license
# Navigate back to the review and notice that *Prefs > Author* cannot be re-selected and is not visible either

Applying a FishEye license will allow the selection and control over the visibility of those fields

*With FishEye enabled*
!with_fisheye.png!

*With FishEye disabled*
!without_fisheye.png!

h3. Workaround
Apply an evaluation FishEye license and enable the columns if needed.
fields.summary: Not able to select Author/Revision/Line count if FishEye license is removed

fields.description: I'm viewing the page that lists revisions of a given file. When I click the review link in the row corresponding to a specific revision (see screenshot), currently Crucible just opens the review. It should open the review and select the file instead.
fields.summary: Review link on the file revisions page should open this file instead of just opening the review

fields.description: Extending the reporting capabilities of Review Coverage Report gadget so that it would show all the changesets associated to a JIRA issue and display the coverage on that grouping basis.
fields.summary: Review coverage by changeset vs JIRA issue key

fields.description: If the AJAX response takes a while to come back, you can click on the dropdown again and have an extra spinner appear on top of the dropdown button.
fields.summary: Double Spinner on autocomplete dropdowns

fields.description:
I've had a few scenarios where I've wanted to embed some formatting alongside text in order to call out different context, e.g.:
{noformat}Variable_X_, {{Method}}ed{noformat}

However, the markup parser doesn't seem to respect embedded sequences of this form. The current best workaround for the above examples are including spaces or apostrophes: Variable _X_, {{Method}}'d. In some cases, difficult to illustrate here, this may even change the meaning of the phrase

Note also, and this may be better filed as a separate issue, but the parser takes a greedy approach for closing failed formatting blocks. For instance, the {{following sect}}ion is all {{monospace}}. I cannot seem to escape the leading markup tag.
fields.summary: Allow for markup sequences to not require spacing
Branch and User are not longer filtered on "add changset to review" dialog
Triggering certain API calls from within event handlers might cause a db deadlock

fields.description:
Currently if you wish to classify a part of code as a defect within a review, you need to add a comment, tick the defect box, select all the classification parameters in different dropdowns and submit.

It would be convenient to:
- Classify defects without adding a comment
- The multiple dropdown selection for defect to be combined to one dropdown/easier way to select
- Defect classification options to be shown by default

The above could be combined to a single dialogue, with keeping the current way of working as well in terms of comments.
fields.summary: Allow easier defect classifications

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Edit a review to send an invite to an email address
# Log out from the server
# Click on the link in the email to accept the invitation
# Login as an existing user
There will Captcha error during login but there is no Captcha shown
# Login again for the second time
Successfully login but it is redirected to the Dashboard not the review
fields.summary: Captcha error when invited reviewer login

fields.description:
There isn't any notification when a review is created.

It would be better to have a notification sent to the Moderator when a review is created.
fields.summary: Sent notification to Moderator about new review

fields.description:
The functionality of filtering by author/committer does not work when applying it to a SCMSource based repo.

The causes are:
- SCMSource repos do not use Lucene so have no explicit committer mappings
- SCMSource always returns empty lists for the findAuthors() method so you cannot retrieve authors for the repo
- CommitterUserMappingManagerImpl.getImplicitCommittersForUserInRep() requires the repos it searches to accessible via RepositoryHandler objects (which the repositoryManager can return) but SCMSource repos cannot be accessed that way

Perhaps a simple solution would be to disable the Author field in the changeset filtering panel (insertConstraintsForm.tag) if the repo selected is a SCMSource type.
fields.summary: Author field does nothing when trying to filter a SCMSource repo

fields.description: When I try to add content to a review based on changeset and select a repo from the Repository selector which has a length greater than 80 characters, I am given a large error and cannot add any changesets.
fields.summary: Impossible to selecting a repo with a name greater than 80 chars when adding to review

fields.description: Changes which are merges do not need to be reviewed and should not count as changes when calculating review coverage.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude merge commits from review coverage statistics

fields.description:
The request is to have FishEye/Crucible able to search for strings which are present in places that are not code comments.

E.g. let's say there are two files, with the fillowing contents: 
File 1: //Content 
File 2: Content
After applying the filter to not return results in code comments, FishEye/Crucible search would return just the File 2.
fields.summary: Search excluding commented code

fields.description:
DefaultReviewManager.getReviewByPermaId() and other methods ask the database to do a case insensitive lookup of the review project key in the ReviewPermaId table.

Unfortunately this causes mysql to not use its perfectly good indexes and do a full table scan which can be slow.

Possible approaches to fix this:
1. (Preferred) do a case sensitive comparison and make sure that every caller of these methods will supply perma IDs with the correct case (and their callers, etc etc etc).
2. Do case sensitive lookup first.  If not found, do case insensitive lookup
3. Lookup only by number component of perma ID, and filter results in java code
fields.summary: DefaultReviewManager.getReviewByPermaId (and also reviewExists) trigger full table scan of ReviewPermaId table on MySQL (and possibly other databases)

fields.description:
I would like to have an option to copy comment URL to clipboard via a keyboard shorcut.

Actually, the request is quite larger, but this is the minimal improvement to the existing scheme.

Let me describe the use case. I participate as a reviewer in several reviews where I leave many comments. I have a need to track comment threads: I need to make sure that review author reads and acts upon all comments in the review in order to consider it done. Currently, Crucible doesn't provide a way to track comment threads in any way; so I have come up with a convention where review author should reply with a comment to all my comments, and if this comment means that the work on my comment is done, I consider this thread “done.” To track threads, I keep a list of URLs to comment threads (pointing to individual comments in these threads) in Checkvist, grouped by review. 

A typical workflow to track existing comment threads is to open all comments from Checkvist and for each thread look if it's done. If it is, the corresponding task in Checkvist is marked as done.

To add a comment, I need to copy comment URL to clipboard and add to Checkvist. Since there is a large amount of comments, I rely on keyboard shortcuts to navigate between threads ({{h}} and {{l}}). (Not all of the comments are worthy of tracking, so I don't add all of them to Checkvist.) But as there is no shortcut to copy comment URL to the clipboard, I have to reach to the mouse, which makes it harder.
fields.summary: Add shortcut to copy comment permalink to keyboard (or let track comment threads)

fields.description: After uploading a patch for review (without anchoring), uploading a newer, better version of the changes does not offer the option to aggregate to the previous patch. This results in two separate patches with two separate source trees in the review, and the differences between the first and the second patch cannot be seen.
fields.summary: Option to Aggregate Patches That Are Not Mapped to a Repository

fields.description:
Hello,

i can find my user under Fisheye username but under commit username my account doesnt exists. What is the reason?

i allready creted an issue https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-5035

Best regards

Sakis
BMW ASCENT Support
fields.summary: Problem with user mapping

fields.description: Currently there's no e-mail notification sent out once an user is added as a review participant. It would be convenient to notify participants on this action.
fields.summary: E-mail notification when one is added as a reviewer

fields.description: Add an option (like a checkbox, for example) that allows to select all the changesets in the list of changesets when browsing them while creating a review or adding content to an existing one.
fields.summary: Add all changesets option when browsing chansets in Crucible review

fields.description:
Is there any easy and sensible way to link commits to review comments?
We use SVN, managed by Teamforge and Crucible.
fields.summary: How to link SVN commits to review comments

fields.description:
I have a GIT repository indexed in FeCru. The repo has approx. 200 branches (feature, personal, etc.). All branches are succesfully imported in Fisheye (visible in repository browser). Bud some of the branches are not visible in Crucible, while adding content to review (using Add Content to Review popup). 

I tried to track the json request to the server (fecru 2.9.1) loading contents of the Branch filter - something like:

http://hostname/cru/CR-S2-364/edit-constraints/admin.int.lmc.cz.git?q=cernyk&limit=50&command=branches
this query omits some branches.

If I tried to modify this query manually to 
http://hostname/cru/CR-S2-364/edit-constraints/admin.int.lmc.cz.git?q=&limit=500&command=branches

it returns only 59 results (instead of approx. 200 expected branches). 

I tried to make full re-clone and re-index, without any change. 

What can be wrong?
It may be similar or the same bug as CRUC-6471.
fields.summary: Some branches are not visible in Branch filter on Add Content to Review

fields.description:
We are having CRs created by our CI build system, using a special account. The creation mechanism sets the CR.creator to the build account, and sets the CR.author to the commit author - an actual human.

When we look at the CR by following a link to the CR generated by our build script and included in an email message, we see the CR just fine, and it shows as being in the draft state with author = whomever.

But when user whomever, above, browses to his Crucible dashboard, the various Inbox folders don't include the CR. Especially, the "In Draft" folder does not include the CR.

I believe this is a bug. If a user is set as the author of a CR in the draft state, the author should be able to see it in his/her "In Draft" inbox.
fields.summary: "Draft" state reviews do not appear in Author's dashboard when not Creator

fields.description:
Currently, in a review, there is a number aside each file indicating the number of comments it contains, and it is necessary to navigate through the file in order to look at these comments.

The request is to have all the comments in one place, like a list of all the comments, in order to get to them without too many clicks or too many navigation.
fields.summary: Show all comments for a file in one place

fields.description:
Crucible documentation is lacking in terms of practical examples when it comes to typical usage scenarios. Case in point: Review of merged changesets.

For the base of a diff, Crucible will use the last commit that changed that file. A merge commit is not considered to have changed a file unless there are changes to that file that are unique to both parents of the merge commit.

It would be nice to have this information detailed with a couple of screenshots to avoid misinterpretations from users.
fields.summary: Provide Documentation and Examples For Reviewing Merged Changesets

fields.description:
Currently when a user goes to add content to a review from browsing changesets, the filter automatically selects a random* committer associated with that user.

It would make more sense to simply filter the changesets by all committers associated with that user instead.

*random as in the first user-committer mapping, in alphabetical ordering
fields.summary: Filter changesets by user rather than by guessing user's default committer

fields.description:
Currently, the Defect Metrics Statistic in the Project View only have comments with 1 month age.

It will be better to summarise all the defect comments in the project.
fields.summary: Summarise all defect comments in Defect Metric Statistic Project view

fields.description:
See attached.

cc [~bbaker], [~igrunert]
fields.summary: Display project name in Create Review project dropdown

fields.description:
Currently, while creating a review, when I click in "Browse Changesets", Crucible automatically fills the Author field with the commiter I have mapped in the Author Mappings, and brings the commits made by this commiter. In the case I have a second commiter set to this repository and want to browse through the commits made by this second commiter, I need to select it in the Author field every time I browse the changesets, and have to wait the commits to load.

It would be nice to have a way to set a commiter as default, in a way that when I browse the changesets the Author field comes filled with this commiter, and loads directly the commits made by this commiter.
fields.summary: Set an Author as default when browsing changesets

fields.description:
h3. Problem
If you have a https:// site URL configured for your Crucible instance and you mention an user in a review comment, the notification e-mail will contain a link to the comment with http:// protocol, regardless if you have the [site URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+the+FishEye+web+server] configured with https://

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set up a Crucible instance running over HTTPS: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+SSL+configuration] or you can simply use a reverse-proxy with HTTPS
# Add two users and [create a review|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Creating+a+review]
# Add a comment to the review, with mentioning one user with the other within the comment
# Notice that the link to the comment contains http:// link, whereas all other links in the e-mail contain the protocol properly with https://
fields.summary: Review comment @mention e-mails contain wrong URL

fields.description:
You have to truncate somewhere, but the existing truncation is too severe, leading to not being able to distinguish between repos with similar names:
!repo names truncated.jpg!

A good idea would also be a tooltip that would show the full name when truncated when one hovers over it - both in the dropdown and in the field itself.

So the full solution would be:

* An increase in the truncation size.
* A tooltip for names that end up truncated anyway.
fields.summary: Add Content to Review: repo names are truncated, leading to inability to distinguish repos with similar names.

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Set up a Trusted Application Link between JIRA 5.1.8 (or higher) and FishEye/Crucible 3.2.3.
# Confirm that the JIRA Issue Source and Review tabs are working.
# Add the following Crucible Inbox Gadget into the JIRA Dashboard:
{noformat}
http://HOSTNAME:8060/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.fecru.fecru-gadgets-plugin:overdueReviews/gadgets/todo.xml
{noformat}
# The Crucible Inbox Gadget is unable to load with the error "Client must be authenticated to access this resource".

h3.Workaround
Switch the application link authentication mode to OAuth
fields.summary: Crucible "Review Inbox" Gadget Does Not Work With Trusted Applications

fields.description:
When indexing a repository from Stash, it should be possible to do code review on changes in forks of that repository on Stash.

It should be possible without having to manually index every fork in Fisheye.

Currently the only way to do this is with a [pre commit review|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Creating+patch+files+for+pre-commit+reviews] (this can also be done with our [review CLI tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Creating+reviews+from+the+command+line]).
fields.summary: When indexing a repository from Stash, it should be possible to do code review on changes in forks of that repository on Stash without having to manually index every fork in Fisheye

fields.description:
For the Quick search:
1) diff total is correct for the "search string" for "Any date" (selected in the Last Modified section"). See attached diff_anydate.png
2) diff total is incorrect for the "search string" for any date selected under the Last Modified section with the exception of "Any date". For this filter, Crucible ignores the "search string" in the diff total. See example attached diff_yesterday.png
fields.summary: Quick search diff total not correct if restricted by date is not "Any date"

fields.description:
If there is any need to modify the file {{crucible.py}}, all the users will need to download and modify the file manually.

I will be better if we can modify the file in Crucible server and saved the modification in FISHEYE_INST so that all the users just need to download it and its easier for server upgrade.
fields.summary: Ability to modify Crucible Pre-Commit Review Script

fields.description:
As per a comment in [CRUC-6398|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-6398?focusedCommentId=455562&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-455562] the current regular expression does not cover lowercase project keys.

Even though lowercase project keys are [not possible in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+Project+Key+Format?from=XgISCw], SVN commit messages with lowercase keys are matched but Crucible links are not.
fields.summary: Unable to Link to JIRA issues With Lowercase Project Keys

fields.description:
It you be really useful if using REST API our users could get a report for managing projects.
For example:
If Crucible could create a report with the most active commiter, commiter who added more lines into the code, or most commited repository choosing the date interval for this.
fields.summary: Reports in REST API

fields.description:
Nowadays, when adding patch files to reviews, the option 'Add to an existing patch' is the default selected.

Some customers would like the option 'Add as a new patch' to be the default option.

This should be configurable from within the administration panel.
fields.summary: Allow configuring the default option when adding patch files to a review

fields.description:
When uploading the review item via REST web service. The source code is not displayed correctly sometimes (see the screenshot).

When clicking the download revision link to download the review item, the review item can be opened in notepad correctly.
fields.summary: Review item is not displayed correctly

fields.description:
When using the Crucible GUI to upload review item, the item will be added as "Added" if it is new; "Modified" if it already exists.

I'm trying to use a REST service to upload the review item to Crucible.
https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/crucible.html#d2e579

According to the document, 
"When only a single file is uploaded, Crucible treats the file as newly added."

If I use the web service to upload review item, each one would be treated as "Added". Crucible is unable to compare changes between versions. Is there a way to make it upload the same way as the GUI?

If the answer is no, how can I change the metadata after the file was uploaded using the REST web service?
fields.summary: How to use REST web service to add ReviewItem to Crucible as "Modified".

fields.description:
If you create a review with multiple revisions, and include a file which has been added in one revision and modified in a later revision, then the file name is marked as blue (modified), not as green (added).

It should be shown as green so that reviewers can see that this is a new file.

Further, only the changes from the modification revision are shown, when all changes to the file ought to be shown (as described in detail on CRUC-6312)
fields.summary: Reviews with multiple revisions: added + modified files are shown in blue (modified), not green (added)

fields.description: It would be useful to label code reviews, so that it's easier to differentiate and/or group the reviews in Crucible.
fields.summary: Labels for code reviews

fields.description:
Hello,
an empty page appears when I try to link an issue to confluence.

due to problems with the Exocet add-on I deleted the existing link
and recreated it. May the link was not created correctly (I can see the linked application in both systems)? how can I check this.
JIRA log shows this message:

/plugins/servlet/applinks/listApplicationLinks [atlassian.applinks.ui.BatchedJSONi18NBuilderFactory] Duplicate i18n entry for key 'applinks.auth.provider.com.atlassian.applinks.api.auth.types.OAuthAuthenticationProvider'

fields.description:
When adding commits to code reviews, the differences shown to reviewers (and other participants) often have little if anything to do with the changes made.

When it goes wrong, the review usually contains some of the right files, but will either show them as new (additions) or will show the wrong diffs (unrelated changes in the same file).

This seems to happen most often, but not exclusively, to branch-merge commits.

The diffs are wrong when compared to the same commit examined in Source Tree, or using the git command line client.

We are estimating this occurs for at least 1-in-50 reviews, perhaps as much as 1-in-20.
fields.summary: Diffs Shown Frequently Have No Relation To Commit

fields.description:
After the Crucible upgrade to version 3.1 we noticed that when we create new reviews with multiple review patches the patches are merged together by default with the wrong filename label.

The steps to recreate are:
1. Create a new review.
2. Upload the first patch to review.
3. Upload a second patch to review.
4. Note that the content of both patches was merged together and listed under the filename of the first patch only.

Is this as designed or some problem with Crucible or its configuration?
fields.summary: New review patches are by default merged into patches previously uploaded

fields.description:
[Crucible REST API call|https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/crucible.html#d2e1224] to get the list of comments in a review should also include the comment ID.

This will allow customers to build reports where they can refer to specific comments and link to them from external services.
fields.summary: Include review comments IDs in the REST API calls for comments.
to delete, manipulation error

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in Crucible which allowed unauthenticated users to commit actions on behalf of any other authorised user. In order to exploit this vulnerability, an attacker requires access to your Crucible web interface. 

A Crucible server is only vulnerable if it has been configured to be a part of an Application link with Trusted Applications authentication.

The vulnerability affects all supported versions of Crucible up to and including 3.1.5 and 2.10.7. It has been fixed in 3.2.0, 3.1.6 and 2.10.8.

For more information, see our [security advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Fisheye+and+Crucible+Security+Advisory+2014-02-26].
fields.summary: Privilege escalation

fields.description:
After a comment is entered, hovering the comment does show all lines as light blue as long as all the lines are on the same window as the comment. If you have multiple lines attached to a comment but a line is off the screen, as soon as you scroll, the lines are no longer highlighted.

Please see the two screenshots attached for reference.
fields.summary: Highlighting problems in peer review comments

fields.description: When creating a new code review, the html email that gets sent out with the participants, objectives, etc is truncated if the Objectives value is too long.
fields.summary: Objectives are cut off in html email
Creating review from command line with a specific author

fields.description:
In many cases, Crucible users will simply use the default avatar. In case you have many reviewers, this makes the review dashboard unusable in terms of identifying quickly who created the review.

As in the 'Reviewer' column there is plenty of place to display the username, it should be at least configurable (if not default behavior) to display the username instead of the avatar there.
fields.summary: Display username instead of avatar on review dashboard

fields.description:
I've disabled Crucible by typing {{Disabled}} in the Crucible license.

This correctly made the "Reviews" menu and the blue "Create Review" dropdown disappear from the web interface.

However, the *Projects* menu is still being displayed, and clicking on it shows the Crucible projects:

!ProjectsMenu.png!
fields.summary: Disabling Crucible doesn't remove the Projects top menu

fields.description:
*Unsupported* workaround:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Increasing+the+maximum+size+of+a+file+attachment+in+a+review
fields.summary: Provide users the ability to increase the attachment size from the current 10MB limit.

fields.description:
SvnSource.get_patch assumes that everyone has a standard svn diff command. Consequently, anyone who uses vimdiff or other tools for viewing diffs needs to disable their non-standard diff tools prior to creating reviews.

By adding the --diff-cmd=diff parameter, you can override the end user's override and consequently actually use a supported svn diff command.

Here's what the change looks like: 

- return check_output([self.configuration.executables[self.executable()], 'diff'])
+ return check_output([self.configuration.executables[self.executable()], 'diff', '--diff-cmd=diff'])

You should do something similar for the other *Source.get_patch methods.
fields.summary: Can't assume default diff commands will work

fields.description:
I have an svn repository in a sub directory of my home directory, and my home directory has a git repository. When I try to use crucible.py for my svn repository, it incorrectly assumes I am trying to create a review for my git repository. I need to be able to specify the repository type to avoid this confusion.

Trying to anchor the review to a specific repository does not seem to work, it looks like crucible.py is dead set on using git.

I've attached a patch. All you need to do to fix it is return from PatchSource.load_patch from within "if patch" and not from within source.is_active()
fields.summary: Guessing the type of repository is insufficient

fields.description:
As a user, I would like the ability to specify whether or not auto-save is enabled.

The background behind this is that our current deployment of crucible can run a bit slow sometimes and this usually results in the auto-save taking a while to be ready before I can post a comment.  Since a lot of my comments are only a few words to perhaps a few lines long I lose a lot of time waiting for the auto-save to complete so that I can click on the post button.

Another bad thing about the auto-save is that it changes the tab order when I go to post a comment.  Typically I can tab twice and then hit enter, but if auto-save kicks off then I lose my focus to a different location.
fields.summary: Auto-save should not prevent me from publishing comments

fields.description:
Hi there,

One great feature in Crucible is the auto-save for comments, for some customers it was going to be really good if the time to auto-save could be changed.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Configurable auto save time

fields.description: When entering a JIRA issue in a comment, the issue could be annotated to indicate it is a JIRA issue or Crucible could validate the key and have the user resolve the conflict.
fields.summary: User should be able to use same project key in JIRA and Crucible

fields.description:
having issues with outgoing emails on our crucible server..

Starting mail system...

mail.smtp.port = 25
mail.from = do-not-reply@crucible.modernizingmedicine.com

DEBUG SMTP: useEhlo true, useAuth false
DEBUG SMTP: trying to connect to host "localhost", port 25, isSSL false
220 testlink_crucible_svn ESMTP Sendmail 8.14.4/8.14.4; Wed, 6 Nov 2013 15:14:51 GMT
DEBUG SMTP: connected to host "localhost", port: 25
EHLO

and added -Dmail.smtp.localhost=crucible.modernizingmedicine.com to the java parameters but it did not help:

root     29727     1 99 15:13 pts/0    00:01:20 /usr/lib/jvm/jre/bin/java -Xmx1024m -XX:MaxNewSize=128m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Dfisheye.library.path= -Dfisheye.inst=/usr/crucible/instance_dir -Djava.awt.headless=true -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/u/crucible/default/lib/endorsed -Dmail.smtp.localhost=crucible.modernizingmedicine.com -jar /u/crucible/default/fisheyeboot.jar start

please let us know how to fix this problem. we need to pass domain name with EHLO command, otherwise our mail server does not accept it (we're using sendmail service on localhost)
